Old: >>52481943 #

Welcome to the Raidcat / 6 Star Tera Raid Meta Thread

>lol I can solo 5 star raids I don't need your ugly cat
6 stars are infinitely harder than 5 and extremely annoying. You can do them the normal way and risk wasting your time, or accept the raidcat as your raid savior.

>What's the meta?
4 Perrserkers. Their Hidden Ability stacks multiplicatively and, if you follow the flowchart, you can one-shot most raids.

>What's the raidcat like?
Perrserker @ Lum Berry
Level 100
Ability: Steely Spirit (Hidden Ability)
EVs: 252 Atk / 252 Speed (Host) or HP (Joiner)
Adamant Nature
- Iron Head
- Screech
- Swords Dance
- Taunt (Host) / Helping Hand (Joiner)

>Host? Joiner? Flowchart?
There's a small difference in strategy whether you are hosting or joining a raid and a specific flowchart. See OP pic.

>Does this work every time?
No, but it's one of the only consistent strategies that you can follow. It's not great against Pokemon that have strong and/or STAB Fire/Fighting/Ground moves, and if their Tera resists Steel it can also take a few more turn (but still doable).

>So what's the hype?
Catraids are simple to organize, have plenty of flowcharts, and finish the job very quickly. It's about efficiency.

>I have a question about raids...
Check OP pic.

>How to get cat with HA?
Language Teacher sidequest, then use an Ability Patch to change its ability. Patch is an 11% drop from 6 Star Raids.

>I tried breeding but I'm getting Kantonian Meowth
Make the G-Meowth hold an Everstone

>wtf I did that but none of them have Steely Spirit
G-Meowth's HA is Unnerve, it becomes Steely Spirit upon evolution.

For other viable meta strategies and mons, Ctrl+F OTHERMONS

For specific strategies, Ctrl+F HARDRAIDS

Use this thread to trade for raidcats, to organize (raidcat) raids, or just to discuss and ask questions about raids in general.

>>52491811
For the record, run a benchmark, fire strike, whatever, and compare to other people. That build is really common. Do you have dual channel ram? 2x8 or 2x16 / 4x8 or 4x16? Are they running with XMP?
If everything about RAM is ok, check your BIOS settings, maybe you manually set the multiplier to something low. I would recommend yo just leave everything at auto and enable XMP/DOCP and then enabling PBO/CO. Also, use hwinfo or something to check the clocks, you should be hitting 4.45Ghz all core and 4.7 or more on single. Use MSI Afterburner and check that it is boosting right and overclock your GPU just by 10MHz to check if it actually clocks more (maybe there is an issue and it's being locked somehow?). Also use GPU z to check if it's running pcie 3/4 at x16 and not x8 or something like that.
Then check temps on both, GPU and CPU.

If everything is fine, maybe you could consider reinstalling Windows if you are using that, unless you get this issue only with the emulator (run benchmarks and compare to other people again).

last_replies.com: I'm trying to catch myself some Eevees, should I basically eat a sandwhich that increases normal type spawn rates and then just go to town trying to find them? Anything else I can do to increase odds of them showing up?

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>52497875
It's nothing I'd really recommend since it's some really high commitment stuff.
But if you want to go super hardcore about it. You could stand in area where eevees spawn, save your game before midnight. And then when you load the game up after midnight the mass outbreaks will be shuffled.

Then check the map to look for Eevee outbreaks. And if there are none, close the game and reload. And look again.
Repeat until you actually get an Eevee outbreak. And if you do, you save your game and then farm the outbreak before your game hits midnight again.

This can take ages potentially though so I wouldn't personally go through that.
A meal that ups Normal Type Encounter rate and then going in and out of town to reset the spawns while scouting should be more than enough.
And then there are always eggs if you don't mind breeding for Eevees.

Yes and no, Volo and Cogita are descendants of the Celestica people, the original inhabitants of Sinnoh.

Now taking the real base Ezo-Hisui (Before being Hokaido-Sinnoh) it was inhabited by various ethnic groups for periods:

Yayois in the south and Nivkhs in the north (the first from Korea and the second from Russia) one of these would be the Celestica people.

Ainu and Orok, these would be represented with the Pearl and Diamond clans.

Finally the people of Yamato (Japanese) these would be represented by people like Kamado, the latter would be the ones who would take the 4 islands by force and decimating the indigenous population.

In short, Cynthia's family were among the first settlers of the original Sinnoh, but they were decimated or expelled from their island, returning to the mainland, that is, Russia.

threads.name: Anonymous
threads.sub: When do you consider Pokémon Black and White tutorial is done?
threads.com:
I've been reading some complaints about how tedious is the tutorial in Scarlet and Violet, and I'm comparing how long would take to beat (as fast as possible) some other Pokémon game's tutorials. With text on faster and skipping cutscenes if available. Pressing A really fast to skip dialogues as fast as I could, but playing in a "regular" way (kinda fast).

And for now I got:
Scarlet and Violet: 1h 10 mins (After all the school introduction when they finally let you free)
Sword and Shield: 49 mins (when you get into the wild area)
Diamond and Pearl: 41 mins (right after the clown's test and fighting your rival for the first time)
Legends Arceus: 1h 24 mins (When they finally let you free in the first zone and you are free to go to the first Noble)

But I'm having some doubts with SM, I feel like the tutorial ends after the school but they stop you a bit more afterwards:

Sun and Moon:
1h 7 mins (Once you get to Hau'oli City Pokémon Center, after Lillie and Hau stops you)
or 1h 13 mins (Once you've also seen the Team Skull part and you're free to go to the first totem)

And with BW I don't really know where to stop the count. Because even after leaving the school and battling Cheren, the gym kinda feels like a tutorial and just right after the gym they stop you again... But maybe that's not a tutorial anymore? But then I should also not count some parts as tutorial for SM or SV?

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>52494589
They're just okay. I really like PMD content so I'm biased. Although I like the OCs in Victory Fire a lot. Even though the main OC is supposed to be a literal child, she's pretty level-headed and catches on quickly to nuances. She rarely complains and soldiers through most pain. I can't tell you how many shitty comics where the OC makes a big deal out of nothing or is a pure stuttering mess. Like "o-omg can I r-really trust you???" when really they have no choice. She can think a bit ahead and skip that crap. She's not a genius (mewtwo is) but pretty competent. That isn't to say the comic is perfect. There are behind-the-scenes stuff involving humans I feel is pretty cringey, story is a bit edgy, and later characters become a bit too apologetic. But overall it has appealing art for my tastes (selfishly my highest criteria), good paneling and pacing, and likeable MCs. Also she doesn't have amnesia, which is refreshing.

I guess I should clarify that there are 3 types of vitamins, and there's their current effects as far I can see:
- Protein: +1 attack, +20 egg steps
- Calcium: +1% base attack, +20 egg steps
- Carbos: -X egg steps, where X is bigger for slower hatching mons.
Limit: 5 combined per region.
I think their intention it's to make the system more "interesting" and balanced, but it kinda fails at it.
The choice between protein and calcium isn't really a choice, you take protein if the pokemon has less than 100 base attack, calcium otherwise.
Carbos at least adds the option to build completely for speed to grind shinies and level up your helpers, sacrificing attack gain in the process. But I can see the devs not liking players using an even faster Magikarp to breeze thought the helper achievements, and adding a new stupid restriction.
And building for breeding efficiency isn't particularly interesting, you just follow the already made spreadsheet
https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1N-85Cf0sP9azcg9Ea1ZzepY6euHfYUCyb7IE894hYJI/edit#gid=585020908
Which shows that, even if it is somehow more balanced, it's overall a huge nerf to breeding efficiency.
